009package Ch13_ColorImages;
010
011
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.HsvColorSpace;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * ImageJ plugin, "rotates" the hue (H) of colors in HSV space by 120 degrees.
023 * Saturation (S) and value (V) remains unchanged. The input image is modified.
024 * Applying the plugin 3 times to the same image should reproduce the original
025 * image. See Sec. 13.2.3 of [1] for details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
029 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 *
034 */
035public class Hsv_Rotate_Hue implements PlugInFilter {
036        
037        private static double ROT = 120.0 / 360;        // shift hue by 1/3 of full circle (120 degrees)
038
039        @Override
040        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus imp) {
041                return DOES_RGB;
042        }
043
044        @Override
045        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
046                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
047                final int[] RGB = new int[3];
048                
049                HsvColorSpace cc = HsvColorSpace.getInstance();
050                
051                for (int v = 0; v < cp.getHeight(); v++) {
052                        for (int u = 0; u < cp.getWidth(); u++) {
053                                cp.getPixel(u, v, RGB);
054
055                                float[] HSV = cc.fromRGB(RgbUtils.normalize(RGB));      // all HSV components are in [0,1]
056//                              HSV[0] = (HSV[0] + ROT) % 1.0f;                                                 // works for positive ROT only
057                                HSV[0] = (float) Arithmetic.mod(HSV[0] + ROT, 1.0);             // ROT may be pos. or negative
058                                int[] RGBnew = RgbUtils.denormalize(cc.toRGB(HSV));
059
060                                cp.putPixel(u, v, RGBnew);
061                        }
062                }
063        }
064}
